comment.body:
@Musickiller:  RaspberryPi is open hardware, as open as most "open hardware" on the market.  The only thing more open in terms of one card PC's is the not-yet-in-production Eoma68,  it did get crowdfunded, but it'll probably be another 6 months at least before anyone sees the final product.   For zeronet Raspberry Pi is enough, also I'd recommend using ethernet, as it is less power-consumption than wireless.  
If you needed something high-power

@Elspru: if you needed something high-performance but still fairly low power consumption can go with an odroid-xu4.  Though just like raspberry pi, there are proprietary blobs.  The only non-blob single board computer I'm aware of is the Eoma68.  https://www.crowdsupply.com/eoma68/micro-desktop

when I try to click on the links, for i.e. Suits season 2 it says "Remote XUL

This page uses an unsupported technology that is no longer available by default in Firefox.

    Please contact the website owners to inform them of this problem."
